name: Blue Prism Outbound Connector
description: Orchestrate your Blue Prism queue with Camunda. You can create new queue items and get the result from it

choices.name: Get item from a queue by ID

properties.label: Type
properties.description: Choose the authentication type

properties.label: Client ID
properties.description: Blue Prism OAuth 2.0 client ID

properties.label: Client secret
properties.description: Blue Prism OAuth 2.0 client secret

properties.label: Work queue ID
properties.description: The queue ID of the item

properties.label: Queue item ID
properties.description: The queue item identifier to be fetched from queue

properties.label: Item type
properties.description: Represents a Blue Prism item type

properties.label: Item value
properties.description: Represents a Blue Prism item value

properties.label: Defer date
properties.description: The earliest time and date that this item is deferred until. Expected date format: yyyy-MM-dd

properties.label: Priority
properties.description: The priority value assigned to the item

pattern.message: Priority must be integer value

properties.label: Status
properties.description: Status value

properties.value: =[{ "data":if bluePrismDataItemValue = null then null else {rows: [{"valueType":bluePrismDataItemType,"value":bluePrismDataItemValue}]}, "deferredDate":if deferDate = null then null else deferDate, "priority":if priority = null then null else priority, "status":if status = null then null else status }]

properties.label: Connection timeout
properties.description: Sets the timeout in seconds to establish a connection or 0 for an infinite timeout

pattern.message: Must be a timeout in seconds (default value is 20 seconds) or a FEEL expression

properties.label: Result variable
properties.description: Name of variable to store the response in. Details in the documentation

properties.label: Result expression
properties.description: Expression to map the response into process variables. Details in the documentation

properties.label: Result expression
properties.description: Expression to map the response into process variables. Details in the documentation

properties.label: Error expression
properties.description: Expression to handle errors. Details in the documentation

properties.label: Issue number
properties.description: The number that identifies the issue

properties.label: Release ID
properties.description: The unique identifier of the release

properties.label: Query
properties.description: The query contains one or more search keywords and qualifiers. Qualifiers allow you to limit your search to specific areas of GitHub

properties.label: Title
properties.description: The title of the issue

properties.label: Title
properties.description: The title of the issue

properties.label: Body
properties.description: The contents of the issue or release or comment

properties.label: Assignees
properties.description: Logins for users to assign to this issue as an array of strings

properties.label: Labels
properties.description: Labels to associate with this issue as an array of strings

properties.label: Tag name
properties.description: Name of the tag

properties.label: Milestone
properties.description: The number of the milestone to associate this issue with

properties.label: Release name
properties.description: The name of the release

properties.label: Repository name
properties.description: The name of the repository

properties.label: Repository name
properties.description: The name of the repository

properties.label: Branch name
properties.description: The name of the branch. Cannot contain wildcard characters. To use wildcard characters in branch names, use the GraphQL API

properties.label: Base
properties.description: The name of the base branch that the head will be merged into

properties.label: Head
properties.description: The head to merge. This can be a branch name or a commit SHA1

properties.label: Organization name
properties.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive

properties.label: Description
properties.description: A short description of the repository

properties.label: Home page
properties.description: A URL with more information about the repository

properties.label: Visibility
properties.description: The visibility of the repository

properties.label: Type
properties.description: Specifies the types of repositories you want returned

properties.label: Sort
properties.description: The property to sort the results by

properties.label: Sort order
properties.description: The order to sort by. Default: asc when using full_name, otherwise desc

properties.label: Commit message
properties.description: Commit message to use for the merge commit. If omitted, a default message will be used

properties.label: Invite email
properties.description: Email address of the person you are inviting, which can be an existing GitHub user

properties.label: Role
properties.description: The role for the new member

properties.label: Issue state
properties.description: The open or closed state of the issue

properties.label: State reason
properties.description: The reason for the state change. Ignored unless state is changed

properties.value: ={"title": if issueTitle = null then null else issueTitle, "body":if githubBody = null then null else githubBody,"assignees":if issueAssignees = null then null else issueAssignees,"milestone":if issueMilestone = null then null else issueMilestone,"labels":if issueLabels = null then null else issueLabels}
={"tag_name": tagName, "body":if githubBody = null then null else githubBody,"name":if name = null then null else name,"make_latest":if makeLatest = null then null else makeLatest}

={"name": if repoName = null then null else repoName, "description": if repoDescription = null then null else repoDescription,"homepage": if repoHomePage = null then null else repoHomePage,"visibility": repoVisibility}

name: Microsoft Office 365 Mail Connector
description: Work with Office 365 Mail via your BPMN process

choices.name: Send mail on behalf of user

properties.label: Type
properties.description: Authentication type

properties.label: OAuth token endpoint
properties.description: The OAuth token endpoint

properties.label: Client ID
properties.description: Your application's client ID from the OAuth client

properties.label: Client secret
properties.description: Your application's client secret from the OAuth client

properties.label: User ID
properties.description: The unique identifier of user. Can be UUID or email

properties.label: Query parameters
properties.description: Query parameters. Supporting OData query parameters

properties.label: User ID
properties.description: The unique identifier of user. Can be UUID or email

properties.label: Folder display name
properties.description: A folder name to be created

properties.label: User ID
properties.description: The unique identifier of user. Can be UUID or email

properties.label: Query parameters
properties.description: Query parameters. Supporting OData query parameters

properties.label: User ID
properties.description: The unique identifier of user. Can be UUID or email

properties.label: Subject
properties.description: Mail subject

properties.label: Body content
properties.description: Mail body content

properties.label: To recipients
properties.description: Target recipients. Must be an array of emails

properties.label: CC recipients
properties.description: Copy recipients. Must be an array of emails

properties.value: ={"message":{"subject":sendMail_subject,"body":{"contentType":sendMail_body_content_type,"content":sendMail_body_content},"toRecipients": for currentEmail in sendMail_to_recipients return {"emailAddress":{"address":currentEmail}},"ccRecipients": if sendMail_cc_recipients != null then for currentEmailCC in sendMail_cc_recipients return {"emailAddress":{"address":currentEmailCC}} else null},"saveToSentItems":"false"}

properties.description: Name of variable to store the response in

properties.label: Result expression
properties.description: Expression to map the response into process variables

properties.description: Expression to handle errors. Details in the documentation.

properties.label: Retries
properties.description: Number of retries

properties.label: Retry backoff
properties.description: ISO-8601 duration to wait between retries

name: OpenAI Outbound Connector
description: Interact with ChatGPT or moderation API

properties.label: OpenAI API key
properties.description: Your OpenAI API key

properties.label: Organization
properties.description: For members of multiple organizations. Details in the OpenAI documentation

properties.value: =if is defined(internal_organization) and internal_organization != null then {"Content-Type":"application/json", "OpenAI-Organization":internal_organization} else {"Content-Type":"application/json"}

properties.label: Operation
properties.description: OpenAI API operation

properties.label: Evaluation input
properties.description: Provide the text to analyze as static value or variable

properties.label: Model
properties.description: Select the model (or Custom for free text)

properties.label: Custom model version
properties.description: Select the model version

properties.label: Temperature
properties.description: Select the temperature (between 0 and 2)

pattern.message: must be a number between 0 and 2 (e.g. 0, 1.4, 2)

properties.label: System message
properties.description: Optional initial instructions for the model

properties.label: Chat history
properties.description: Optional chat history, or examples of the desired model behavior

properties.label: Prompt
properties.description: Input to be evaluated

properties.label: Choices to generate
properties.description: Amount of alternative responses the model will generate

pattern.message: must be a positive integer number

properties.value: =append(concatenate(if is defined(internal_systemMessage) then [{"role": "system", "content": internal_systemMessage}] else [], if is defined(internal_chatHistory) then internal_chatHistory else []), {"role": "user", "content": internal_prompt})

={"model": if is defined(internal_custom_model) then internal_custom_model else internal_model, "messages": internal_messages, "n": number(internal_choices), "temperature": number(internal_temperature)}

properties.label: Result variable
properties.description: Name of variable to store the response in. Details in the documentation

properties.label: Result expression
properties.description: Expression to map the response into process variables. Details in the documentation

properties.label: Connection timeout
properties.description: Sets the timeout in seconds to establish a connection or 0 for an infinite timeout

pattern.message: must be a timeout in seconds (default value is 30 seconds) or a FEEL expression

properties.label: Error expression
properties.description: Expression to handle errors. Details in the documentation

properties.description: The desktop flow script input parameters (json serialized string)

properties.description: URL that will be called once the desktop flow script is complete. You can use the webhook connector for this purpose

choices.name: Get the status of a flow run

properties.label: Organization URI
properties.description: Dynamics 365 URL. Find your organization url. See also this page

properties.label: Type
properties.description: Choose the authentication type

properties.label: OAuth token endpoint
properties.description: Find out more here

properties.label: Client Id (secret ID)
properties.description: Microsoft Azure Application Client id. See where to find it

properties.label: Client secret (Client secret value)
properties.description: Microsoft Azure Application Client Secret value. See where to find it

properties.label: Flow session ID
properties.description: Unique identifier for entity instances. You can find this in the response of the 'Trigger a flow run' method

properties.label: Workflow ID (flow ID)
properties.description: The ID of the desktop flow that you want to run

properties.label: Connection name
properties.description: Identifies the connection to be used with the desktop flow script

properties.label: Connection type
properties.description: Identifies which type of connection is used in the connectionName

properties.label: Run mode
properties.description: Choose between attended or unattended

properties.label: Run priority
properties.description: Choose an option (normal, high) or add your own

properties.label: Timeout
properties.description: Timeout for Power Automate script execution in seconds (default = 3 hours, max = 24 hours)

properties.label: Inputs
properties.description: The desktop flow script input parameters (json serialized string)

properties.label: Callback URL
properties.description: URL that will be called once the desktop flow script is complete. You can use the webhook connector for this purpose

properties.value: ={"runMode":if runMode = null then null else runMode, "runPriority":if runPriority = null then null else runPriority,"connectionName":if connectionName = null then null else connectionName,"timeout":if runTimeout = null then 7200 else runTimeout,"inputs":if runInputs = null then null else runInputs,"connectionType":if connectionType = null then 1 else connectionType,"callbackUrl":if callbackUrl = null then null else callbackUrl}

properties.description: Your Twilio auth token. See Camunda documentation

properties.label: Message SID
properties.description: Obtain information regarding the message with SID

properties.label: Message text
properties.description: The content of the message that will be sent

properties.label: From number
properties.description: The originating Twilio phone number used for sending the message

properties.label: To number
properties.description: The recipient's phone number

properties.label: Page size
properties.description: The maximum number of messages to retrieve per page

properties.label: Date sent
properties.description: The date and time the message was sent (in UTC format)

properties.label: Date before message was sent
properties.description: The date and time before which messages were sent (in UTC format)

properties.label: Date after message was sent
properties.description: The date and time after which message was sent (in UTC format)

properties.label: From
properties.description: The phone number or client identifier of the message sender

properties.label: To
properties.description: The phone number or client identifier of the message recipient

name: UiPath Outbound Connector
description: Orchestrate your UiPath bots with Camunda. You can create new queue items and get the result from it

choices.name: Get queue item result by ID

properties.label: Type
properties.description: Choose the authentication type

properties.label: Client ID
properties.description: UiPath OAuth 2.0 client ID

properties.label: Client secret
properties.description: UiPath OAuth 2.0 client secret

properties.label: UiPath organization
properties.description: Your organization ID

properties.label: UiPath tenant
properties.description: Your tenant name

properties.label: Organization unit ID
properties.description: UiPath folder or organization unit ID

properties.label: Queue name
properties.description: The name of the queue to which to submit the queue item

properties.label: Defer date
properties.description: The earliest date and time at which the item is available for processing. If empty the item can be processed as soon as possible. Expected date format: yyyy-MM-dd

properties.label: Due date
properties.description: The latest date and time at which the item should be processed. If empty the item can be processed at any given time. Expected date format: yyyy-MM-dd

properties.label: Priority
properties.description: The priority to apply to the queue item

properties.label: Specific content for a UiPath job
properties.description: Data that will be passed in to the job. It should be in the JSON format

properties.label: Reference
properties.description: A string reference for the queue item

properties.label: Item ID
properties.description: The item ID to be fetched

name: UiPath connector
description: Orchestrate your UiPath bots with Camunda. You can create new queue items and get the result from it

choices.name: Get queue item result by ID

properties.label: Type
properties.description: Choose the authentication type

properties.label: Client ID
properties.description: UiPath OAuth 2.0 client ID

properties.label: Client secret
properties.description: UiPath OAuth 2.0 client secret

properties.label: UiPath organization
properties.description: Your organization ID

properties.label: UiPath tenant
properties.description: Your tenant name

properties.label: Organization unit ID
properties.description: UiPath folder or organization unit ID

properties.label: Queue name
properties.description: The name of the queue to which to submit the queue item

properties.label: Defer date
properties.description: The earliest date and time at which the item is available for processing. If empty the item can be processed as soon as possible. Expected date format: yyyy-MM-dd

properties.label: Due date
properties.description: The latest date and time at which the item should be processed. If empty the item can be processed at any given time. Expected date format: yyyy-MM-dd

properties.label: Priority
properties.description: The priority to apply to the queue item

properties.label: Specific content for a UiPath job
properties.description: Data that will be passed in to the job. It should be in the JSON format

properties.label: Reference
properties.description: A string reference for the queue item

properties.label: Item ID
properties.description: The item ID to be fetched
